Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Monday July 21), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for monday, july 21st. microsoft has announced a major partnership with openai to integrate advanced language models into its office suite, aiming to revolutionize productivity tools with ai-driven features. this collaboration could redefine how businesses utilize word processing and spreadsheets, as microsoft looks to cement its position as a leader in ai innovation.

in other news, amazon is expanding its drone delivery program with plans to roll out the service in over 20 new locations by the end of the year. the company has reported successful trials, boasting delivery times of under 30 minutes, and aims to enhance its logistics network further, tapping into the ever-growing demand for faster delivery options.

meanwhile, google's parent company alphabet reported a robust 15 percent increase in quarterly revenue, driven primarily by a surge in digital advertising and cloud services. the growth showcases resilience in the face of global economic challenges, as the tech giant continues to expand its data centers and push into new markets.

finally, nvidia shares are soaring after the chipmaker revealed plans to launch a new line of ai-focused gpus, optimized for machine learning tasks. this announcement comes amidst a growing need for more powerful processing capabilities, as industries ranging from healthcare to finance increasingly rely on ai.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for monday, july 21st.

microsoft is making headlines with a significant partnership, teaming up with openai to integrate sophisticated language models into its office suite. this move aims to transform productivity tools with ai-driven features, potentially reshaping the way businesses approach word processing and spreadsheets. with this collaboration, microsoft seeks to solidify its standing as a frontrunner in ai innovation.

meanwhile, amazon is upping its game in the logistics arena by expanding its drone delivery program. the company plans to launch the service in over 20 new locations by year's end. following successful trials boasting delivery times of under 30 minutes, amazon aims to enhance its logistics network to meet the increasing demand for faster delivery options.

switching gears to alphabet, google's parent company, which announced a strong 15 percent rise in quarterly revenue. this growth, primarily fueled by a surge in digital advertising and cloud services, highlights the company's resilience amid global economic challenges. as alphabet continues to expand its data centers, it's making strides into new markets.

lastly, nvidia is capturing attention in the market, with shares climbing after the chipmaker revealed its plans to launch a new line of ai-focused gpus. these gpus are optimized for machine learning tasks, addressing the growing demand for more powerful processing capabilities as industries from healthcare to finance increasingly depend on ai.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-326 Microsoft & Openai's Ai-powered Office Suite 🤖, Amazon's Drone Delivery Expansion 🚁, Alphabet's Revenue Surge 📈
Podcast Description:
```html

welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for monday, july 21st! delve into today's impactful tech developments:

  • microsoft & openai partnership: a strategic collaboration to integrate advanced language models into microsoft's office suite, transforming productivity with ai-driven features.
  • amazon's drone delivery expansion: aiming to enhance logistics by launching drone delivery in over 20 new locations by year-end, promising delivery times under 30 minutes.
  • alphabet's financial growth: google's parent company reports a 15% rise in quarterly revenue, driven by digital advertising and cloud services expansion amid global challenges.
  • nvidia's new ai-focused gpus: unveiling a new line of gpus optimized for machine learning, meeting the increasing industry demand for powerful processing capabilities.

stay tuned for tomorrow's tech updates!

```
Image Prompt: the podcast cover image features a dynamic, futuristic cityscape illuminated by the soft glow of advanced technology. in the foreground, sleek drones hover gracefully, casting subtle shadows on the ground as they prepare to deliver packages, symbolizing amazon's expanding drone delivery services. dominating the skyline, a shimmering glass skyscraper represents microsoft & openai's ai-powered office suite, with digital holograms of office applications swirling around its peak. in the sky above, a vibrant graph arcs across the scene, signifying alphabet's revenue surge, with dynamic lines and nodes converging from city lights below. the image captures a seamless blend of innovation and progress, reflecting the interconnected impact of these technological advancements on the urban landscape
